greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Denominators of fractions that answer the question "If x + y = 1 and x^2 + y^2 = 2, then x^n + y^n ="
comment: The denominators of the coefficients of the Taylor series representation of GF(x) = (1+x)/(1-2*x-11*x^2-6*x^3) around x=-1 lead to this sequence, see the Maple program. - _Johannes W. Meijer_, Aug 16 2010
example: a(3) = 2 because x^3 + y^3 is 2.5 and 2.5 is 5/2
maple: nmax:=45: f:=n-> coeftayl((1+x)/(1-2*x-11*x^2-6*x^3), x=-1, n): a(1):=1: for n from 0 to nmax do a(n+2):= denom(f(n)) od: seq(a(n),n=1..nmax); # _Johannes W. Meijer_, Aug 16 2010
program: (PARI) a(n) = denominator(2*polcoeff( lift( Mod((1+x)/2,x^2-3)^n ), 0)) \\ _Max Alekseyev_, Feb 23 2010
results.author: _J. Lowell_, Feb 15 2010
